rules.title: Active voice
rules.abstract: Active voice keeps the actor and actions clear. To write in the active voice, compose sentences where the subject of the sentence performs the action of the verb. The active voice identifies the actor for each action. When users read instructions written with active voice, they find it is easier to understand the instructions and to know who does what, where, when, and how. Active voice is dynamic and interesting to read; it keeps the reader's attention. Active voice is the standard for technical writing.

rule.rule-statement: Use the active voice for all instruction titles.
Use the active voice for all instructions.
